comments: Professor Clouther is by far the best writing instructor in Stony Brook. He is open and charismatic and does his best to help his students succeed. Although he is transferring to a different school, I truly hope that his future students will enjoy his class as much as I did.

stu_tags: TOUGH GRADER  RESPECTED  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK
comments: Clouther is one of the best professors I\'ve had at Stony Brook. He really makes you work for your grade, you can\'t just breeze through the class. However he is very supportive and when you go to his office hours he is always there to help and give support. Also he provided many extra credit opportunities during the course of the semester.

comments: LOVED LOVED LOVED HIM! Not much of a writer but he made this class very enjoyable with the pieces he picked to read and discuss. He\'s very nice, a very fair grader with papers and clear on what he\'s looking for.

stu_tags: PARTICIPATION MATTERS  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS
comments: Professor Clouther is amazing if you\'re lucky enough to get him for WRT 102 or if you take any of his other classes at SBU. He knows what he\'s talking about and genuinely cares about students success and opinion. This isn\'t an easy A class, you must do the work and do it well, but Professor Clouther will always be there to help you succeed.

stu_tags: RESPECTED  GET READY TO READ  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK
comments: Professor Clouther cares a lot about his work. There are discussions in class each day about the readings that help students get a better understanding of them. Professor Clouther is an honest grader and will help you as long as you show effort in class. Very engaging and easy to talk to.

comments: Professor Clouther was an amazing professor! The material for the class is boring but Professor Clouther actually made it fun and interesting. He genuinely cares about what he\'s teaching and cares about his students. He\'s a really nice professor and if you\'re struggling with the work just to see him during office hours he\'s always ready to help

stu_tags: SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  TOUGH GRADER  EXTRA CREDIT
comments: Dr. Clouther is a great professor. Confusing papers based on grammatical concepts, which he grades a bit harshly, but offered 2 extra credit opportunities to bump up lowest grades. Funny, calming, and promotes class discussion since it\'s also a course on rhetoric. Small class - attendance counts. Easily accessible and generally a joy to deal with.

comments: Professor Clouther is great. If you do the readings, participate in class, and write decent drafts, you\'ll be fine.

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (7)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (5)  Participation matters (4)  Respected (4)  Tough Grader (3)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)
comments: The class had about 15 students or so with interactive workshops every class. Everyone will have to submit personal essay drafts that will be read by all other students. Participation is CRUCIAL and you have to read/ make suggestions about other student\'s personal essays. Lenient GRADER! ATTEND+ WRITE 2 REASONABLE DRAFTS + SUBMIT 1 REVISION A/A-

stu_tags: PARTICIPATION MATTERS  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  TOUGH GRADER
comments: He focused analyzing short stories. That did not help you writing your first draft(10% each) and your portfolio(50%). His assignment is confusing or non-sense. He asked you to research on how others think about the author of one of the short stories manipulate emotion. No scholars would discuss that. Nobody knows what he wants and he just give B-\'s

stu_tags: PARTICIPATION MATTERS  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.
comments: Prof Clouther is an amazing teacher. He really wants you to learn how to write. He caters to the different writing styles and allows you to see the beauty of writing. Take this class! It\'s a fun class. Participate and do the work that is asked of you. Wonderful class.

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (7)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (5)  Participation matters (4)  Respected (4)  Tough Grader (3)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)
comments: Must be in class! Participate and go to a couple office hours! Just do the readings--not much work-- and you will do great in the class! I am MAT major and did great and I am a terrible writer!

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (7)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (5)  Participation matters (4)  Respected (4)  Tough Grader (3)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)
comments: I\'ve taken WRT 102, 303, 302 with him, and he is PHENOMENAL in all of them. He has a very calming aura that invites discussion, and he is a joy to speak with during office hours. He loves talking with you, no matter what skill level, and offers great advice. He is so well read and exudes intelligence in a way that is not condescending.

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (7)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (5)  Participation matters (4)  Respected (4)  Tough Grader (3)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)
comments: If you\'re doing this for an easy DEC, go ahead. He doesn\'t care about how much you write (he says 20 pages, but some people wrote less because of spacing). Just participate in class a lot and you\'ll get an A. It might be a Fiction Writing class, but he doesn\'t seem to like imaginative stories; he really just wants to see realistic, cheesy ones.

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (7)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (5)  Participation matters (4)  Respected (4)  Tough Grader (3)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)
comments: This professor is great. He is passionate and very funny. He is so helpful and really sheds light on an interesting way to look at literature. I learned a lot from him.

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (7)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (5)  Participation matters (4)  Respected (4)  Tough Grader (3)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)
comments: Professor Clouther was an outstanding professor. He was organized, funny, and even let us run loose outside a couple classes to get our creative juices flowing. You write on a few short prompts, read several short stories, and write two of your own. He makes class fun and will teach you a lot. If you\'re still reading this review- TAKE THIS PROF! =]

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (7)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (5)  Participation matters (4)  Respected (4)  Tough Grader (3)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)
comments: Prof. Clouther\'s the best! He is a very smart guy and will tell you how to improve your story without being mean about it. My writing and storytelling has improved so much thanks to this course. TAKE WRT302 WITH CLOUTHER!!!

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (7)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (5)  Participation matters (4)  Respected (4)  Tough Grader (3)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)  Caring (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Hilarious (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)
comments: I recommend creative fiction for anyone interested in writing. It was my "fun class" and went towards the new writing minor. Professor Clouther is very straightforward and organized, which I appreciate in an such an open environment. Quick readings and write two short stories. Clouther is very knowledgeable and helpful during revision process.
